summary: The concept of "tourist guide" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks refers to professionals who provide information and assistance to tourists, enhancing their travel experience. This role is often regulated to ensure compliance with standards of quality and safety, which may include licensing requirements and adherence to local laws. Tourist guides play a crucial part in promoting cultural heritage and sustainable tourism practices, aligning with EU objectives for responsible travel. The regulatory landscape may vary across member states, necessitating harmonization efforts to facilitate cross-border tourism and protect both tourists and the integrity of the profession.
